text: The point I think is that the history of transportation planning from the mid- to the end of the century has been dominated by men. Women and marginalized groups have suffered. There’s a sea change underway. It’s also #IWD so chill out with the false indignation.

text:
Since Lane County and Eugene, OR started hiring mostly female transportation planners, we've lost most of our cycling community. Eugene is down from 10.8% cyclists in 2009 to 4.4% in 2017.

Hint: It's not the gender that caused the decline. Drop the inappropriate sexism.
text_html: Since Lane County and Eugene, OR started hiring mostly female transportation planners, we've lost most of our cycling community. Eugene is down from 10.8% cyclists in 2009 to 4.4% in 2017. Hint: It's not the gender that caused the decline. Drop the inappropriate sexism.

text: I’m referring to the residential passes, which are indeed intended to keep people who aren’t residents from parking in dense neighborhoods. It’s worth thinking about: the most dense zones should super charge parking to discourage car ownership.
